intro: Leandra linearifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf leandra, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves and showy, pink or white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and tropical landscapes.
